Fate: Broken up, 1962, Parts of the ship preserved at Sioux Falls, South Dakota
Displacement:
37,970 long tons (38,580 t) (standard)
44,519 long tons (45,233 t) (full load)
Installed power:
130,000 shp (97,000 kW)
Eight Babcock & Wilcox boilers
Crew:
1,793 officers and enlisted men (peace)
2,500 officers and enlisted men (war)
Armament:
9 × 16 in (406.4 mm)/45 caliber Mark 6 guns
16 × 5 in (127.0 mm)/38 caliber DP guns
7 × quad 40 mm (1.6 in) Bofors guns
7 × quad 1.1 in (28 mm) guns
34 × 20 mm (0.79 in) Oerlikon cannons
8 × .50-cal machine-guns
Armor:
Belt: 12.2 in (310 mm)
Deck: 6 in (152 mm) 
Turrets: 18 in (46 cm)
Barbettes: 17.3 in (439 mm)
Conning tower: 16 in
